title: Soap Typeface
content:
Hello,

I am currently working on a logo and branding project for a new shop selling organic handmade soap. I am really stuck on what typefaces I could use. The client's company is sort of like LUSH, they use a lot of spices and herbs in their soaps.

Would anyone be able to point me in the right direction of some typefaces you think could be suitable for such a job..?

Best,  
James
author: jamesaallen

comments.content:
How about [Vista Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320000702/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/emigre/vista_slab_medium_ot/)? It's soft, clean, and très organic!

-Eric MacLeod

I think you should use the Soap Typeface only because it's the first thing that I thought of when I saw your subject line . . . and that's reason enough.

[Soap](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320000702/http:/www.typodermic.com/46.html)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320000702im_/http:/typophile.com/files/46_3481.png)

. . . probably not suitable tho.

Thanks for the replies guys, I like the idea of using a slab serif typeface as recommended by Eric, Thanks.

James

Here's one that I designed for such a luxury soap business. To me, handcrafted products are suited to a calligraphic style.
